response:
Urgent high-resolution MRI and vascular imaging are needed to define the right midbrain lesion and exclude aneurysm or haemorrhage; CSF studies and evoked potentials support or refute demyelinating disease; blood tests screen for vascular risk factors, systemic inflammation, alternative inflammatory conditions and metabolic mimics and ensure safety for steroids or antithrombotic therapy.

investigations = ["MRI of brain and whole spinal cord with gadolinium contrast", "MR angiography of intracranial and neck vessels", "Lumbar puncture with CSF cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands, IgG index and viral PCR", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "C-reactive protein", "Coagulation screen", "Fasting blood glucose", "Lipid profile", "Thyroid function tests", "Vitamin B12 level", "Serum folate level", "Serum ACE level", "Antinuclear antibody", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody", "Aquaporin-4 IgG antibody", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein (MOG) antibody", "Visual evoked potentials"]
